captions.text: START

00:05
COMM: Sean Stephenson and Mindie Kniss are

just like any other married couple despite
the fact that Sean suffers from brittle bone
disorder and is only 2 ft 8 inches tall.

00:19
SEAN: It's a joy to get to be married to this

woman not a day goes by where I don't tell
her I love her probably

00:30
MINDIE: 8,000 times

00:30
SEAN: 8,000 times, I think people when they

look at our marriage they think how sweet
of a person Mindie is to be in love with me

and if they only knew how much I take care
of her and put up with her they would be seeing
me.

00:45
MINDIE: Yeah, they've got it all backwards.

00:47
SEAN: I'm the saint in this marriage, trust
me.

00:51
COMM: The motivational speakers married in

September 2012 after meeting in 2009. They
share a home together in Arizona USA and Sean

tries to maintain as much independence as
possible.

01:06
MINDIE: On a daily basis Sean actually doesn't

need that much help, typically what he might
need help with is showering and he likes that
because he gets to hang out with a naked woman.

01:18
COMM: The 35 year old was born with Osteogenesis

Imperfecta or brittle bone disorder and by
the time he was 18, had suffered over 200

fractures in his legs, arms, neck, collar
bone, ankle, femur and nose.

01:33
SEAN: I can't just mindlessly go to the store

by myself, I have to be aware of my surroundings
because the littlest bum or step down off

of a larger curb could be fatal to me and
thats just something that's a part of my life

and its uh something that also brings a lot
of gifts too, nobody uh forgets Sean Stephenson
after they meet him.

01:56
COMM: But its just the normal ups and downs
of marriage the couple contends with most.

02:01
SEAN: It's not easy, I mean there are days

-
MINDIE: That's true.

SEAN: There are days when we will have to
spend an entire day talking through hurt or

frustration or upset or confusion and we do
out best to work through it.

02:15
MINDIE The relationship itself isn't always

effortless so we're willing to do the work
to maintain that bond and then typically it
just grows stronger.

02:24
COMM: After two years of marriage the couple

still receive hate mail from internet trolls
suggesting that Sean will be unable to satisfy

Mindie, and that she's only with him for his
money.

02:34
SEAN: I think Mindie would be the first to

admit that I'm the most sexual, aggressive
-

MINDIE: Person I have probably ever met in
my life.

02:42
SENA: Yeah, on the planet.

MINDIE: Ever, in fact.
SEAN: Yeah and so sex is a very important
part of my life.

02:47
COMM: Despite their happiness Sean's condition

has meant the decision to have children of
their own has not been an easy one to make.

02:54
MINDIE: It truly is the flip of a coin. So

we could y'know have a fifty fifty chance.
Either have a kid with OI or -

03:01
SEAN: We've gone back and forth on whether

it would be y'know a good thing or a bad thing
or did we want to or not want to bring a child
into this world.

03:11
COMM: But having children is a matter of when
and not if for the couple.

03:15
MINDIE: I spent a lot of time in Africa and

just saw kids that needed parents so there
are so many children out there that could

use great parents so adoption may be an option
for us if we choose to go down that path.

03:27
COMM: The couple are planning on buying their

own home, which they'll modify for Sean within
the next five years. And are completely focused

on their marriage and businesses, instead
of other people's opinions.

03:39
SEAN: I think people are uncomfortable with

the idea that those with disabilities are
normal human beings, and that they have sexual

desires and fantasies and enjoy being touched
and touching. And so I think it's a big statement

more about people's uncomfortableness with
their own bodies and the thought of the disabled
having sex lives.
END
